intro: Zanthoxylum canalense, commonly known as the canal prickly ash, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but have a sharp, acidic flavor. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh environments make it a notable species in its native habitat.
